greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: If the smallest prime with a square excess of n is p then a(n)^2 = p - n.
link: Ivan Neretin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(4)=3 because the smallest prime with a square excess of 4 is 13 and 13 - 4 = 3^2.
mathematica: a = {}; Do[p = 2; While[n != p - (r = Floor@Sqrt[p])^2, p = NextPrime[p]]; AppendTo[a, r], {n, 74}]; a (* _Ivan Neretin_, May 02 2019 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = {my(p=2); while(n != p-sqrtint(p)^2, p = nextprime(p+1)); sqrtint(p - n);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, May 05 2019
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jul 05 2000
